text.p: These are the headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Manning calls rivals unity threat: Reform Leader casts Chretien, Charest with separatists, and new ad echoes theme.
- NDP Leader supports euthanasia: Wants guidelines if consent clear.
- B.C. cancels military lease: Presses Ottawa, U.S. on salmon.
- Yeltsin fires military leaders: Defence minister, top commander blamed for blocking reform of armed forces.
- Science squirms under the microscope: A series of painful revelations at the Morin inquiry make it plain that forensic scientists are not infallible and their findings can be misused.
- Blue chips lead TSE to record: 300-share index gains on strong fundamentals, investors' comfort in quality, analysts say.
- GM ponders making hybrid vehicle in Oshawa: Minivan-sport utility mix expected for 2001, sources say.
- Hibernia oil platform sets sail today: Tow-out of structure to Grand Banks marks end of six years of construction and beginning of production setup.
- Bre-X's Felderhof surrenders prospector of the year award: No one to receive prize; TSE named in suit against firm.
- Tee-Comm pushed into receivership: Board resigns after Bank of Montreal makes move.
- Tee-Com slides into receivership: Satellite TV firm's five-man board resigns after Bank of Montreal demands repayment of credit facility.
- TSE named in new Bre-X class action suit.
